intro: Hackelia mundula, commonly known as the mountain bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open woodlands and mountainous regions. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Hackelia mundula is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to full sun to partial shade.
